Package gpjl.network

Class Endpoint

java.lang.Object
gpjl.network.Endpoint
Direct Known Subclasses:
Client, Server
public abstract class Endpoint
extends java.lang.Object
The Endpoint class represents an Endpoint of a Socket-Connection.
Since:
0.1
See Also:
DisconnectedException, Client, Server

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static byte DISCONNECT
    Sending the Value -1 indicates that nothing will be sent anymore.
    static byte OBJECT
    Sending the Value 1 indicates that a serializable Object will be sent.
    static byte STRING
    Sending the Value 0 indicates that a String will be sent.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Endpoint()

    boolean connect​(int port)
    Connects using connectSocket() and sets up IOStreams.

    Connects a Socket to some other Socket.
    void disconnect()
    Disconnects the socket.
    boolean isConnected()
    Checkst the Connection-State using !Socket.isClosed().
    protected abstract void onDisconnect()
    Is called when the other Endpoint sent DISCONNECTED.

    Handles an incoming Object that implements Serializable.
    protected abstract void readString​(java.lang.String string)
    Handles an incoming String.
    void sendEnd()
    Sends DISCONNECT to notify the other Endpoint and calls disconnect().

    Sends a Object to the other Endpoint.

      Sending the Value -1 indicates that nothing will be sent anymore.

      public Endpoint()

  • Method Details

    • connectSocket

      protected abstract java.net.Socket connectSocket​(int port) throws java.io.IOException
      Connects a Socket to some other Socket.
      Parameters:
      port - The port int
      Returns:
      A connected Socket
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If building the Connection failed

    • readString

      protected abstract void readString​(java.lang.String string)
      Handles an incoming String.
      Parameters:
      string - A String that has been sent by the other Endpoint

    • readObject

      protected abstract void readObject​(java.lang.Object object)
      Handles an incoming Object that implements Serializable.
      Parameters:
      object - A Object that has been sent by the other Endpoint

    • onDisconnect

      protected abstract void onDisconnect()
      Is called when the other Endpoint sent DISCONNECTED.

    • connect

      public boolean connect​(int port)
      Connects using connectSocket() and sets up IOStreams.
      Parameters:
      port - The port int
      Returns:
      true if building the Connection succeeded, false if it failed

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the socket.

    • sendEnd

      public void sendEnd()
      Sends DISCONNECT to notify the other Endpoint and calls disconnect().

    • sendString

      public void sendString​(java.lang.String string)
      Sends a String to the other Endpoint.
      Parameters:
      string - A String that will be sent.

    • sendObject

      public <T extends java.io.Serializable> void sendObject​(T obj)
      Sends a Object to the other Endpoint.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class of the Object which has to implement Serializable
      Parameters:
      obj - A Object that will be sent.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checkst the Connection-State using !Socket.isClosed().
      Returns:
      true if Socket isn't closed, false if it is
